intro: Neobartsia inaequalis subsp. brachyantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved neobartsia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The species is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in cymes, and are borne on short pedicels. This subspecies is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky areas.
